allQuestions.explanation: The purpose of engine oil is to lubricate and cool the moving parts of the engine. Refer to the vehicle handbook for further information and guidance.

allQuestions.question: When is it recommended to use coolant?
options: All year round.
Summer only.
In petrol engines only.
Winter only.
allQuestions.explanation: The purpose of coolant is to keep the engine cool during operation. Coolant is usually a mixture of water and anti-freeze - this ensures that the engine is kept cool and that the coolant does not freeze in very cold weather.

allQuestions.question: What does the warning light and/or red zone on a fuel gauge mean?
options: The incorrect type of fuel is in the tank.
The level of fuel in the tank is low.
There is a leak in the fuel system.
allQuestions.explanation: Many vehicles are fitted with various warning lights and gauges. A red zone or a warning light on a fuel gauge means the vehicle is low in fuel and should be refuelled as soon as possible.

allQuestions.question: What happens if the vehicle has a flat battery?
options: The battery will leak acid into the engine.
The battery will have to be replaced.
The head light bulbs will have to be replaced.
The engine will not start.
allQuestions.explanation: All motor vehicles have a battery to supply power, primarily to start the engine. If the battery is flat, the driver will not be able to start the engine in the normal way. When the engine is running, it produces its own electricity to recharge the battery and run the various electrical components, including lights, heating, the radio and so on. If the battery is completely dead it will have to be replaced.

allQuestions.question: What is the primary purpose of the battery fitted to a petrol - or diesel - powered motor vehicle?
options: To reduce fuel consumption.
To provide braking.
To provide heat to the engine.
To start the engine.
allQuestions.explanation: The primary purpose of the battery is to start the engine. When the engine is running, it produces its own electricity to charge the battery and run the various electrical components, including lights, heating, radio and so on.

allQuestions.question: What effect would a weak battery have on a vehicle's driving performance?
options: The fuel would burn less efficiently.
The headlights would not function.
Uphill acceleration would be reduced.
It would have no effect.
allQuestions.explanation: It might be difficult to start a car with a weak battery, but once the engine is running, it makes no difference. If the battery fails to charge or maintain its full charge seek advice from a competent person.

allQuestions.question: What effect can a worn shock absorber have on a vehicle?
options: It can cause the vehicle to 'bounce' in an unstable manner.
It can cause an electrical short-circuit.
It can increase fuel consumption.
It can trigger the release of the airbags.
allQuestions.explanation: A worn shock absorber can seriously affect the control of the vehicle especially on uneven surfaces or when cornering and can cause unnecessary wear and tear on tyres. It may increase stopping distance by not keeping the tyres in proper contact with the road under harsh braking.

allQuestions.question: What does the speed rating of a tyre indicate?
options: The maximum speed the vehicle can be driven at.
The maximum speed for which the tyre is designed.
The minimum speed for which the tyre is designed.
allQuestions.explanation: The speed rating of a tyre is the maximum speed for which the tyre is designed. This relates to the speed capability of the tyre. It does not relate to the speed at which the tyre should or could legally be driven.

allQuestions.question: Why should the valve be replaced when having a tubeless tyre fitted?
options: To ensure the wheel remains balanced.
To ensure the wheel nuts remain tight.
To ensure the wheel remains aligned.
To ensure the tyre will remain inflated.
allQuestions.explanation: When fitting a new tubeless tyre to a vehicle it is recommended to change the valve. This is because the old valve has been on the wheel since the old tyre was fitted. The old valve may break down, leak or cause air to escape.

allQuestions.question: What effect does low tyre-pressure have on a vehicle?
options: The engine noise increases.
Braking and cornering are impaired.
The vehicle accelerates faster.
The brakes can overheat.
allQuestions.explanation: Incorrect tyre pressure adversely affects many of a vehicle's systems, including suspension, steering and fuel consumption. In particular, under-inflated tyres can affect the vehicle's braking ability and its effectiveness when cornering. Tyres should always be inflated according to the vehicle manufacturer's guidelines, information on which can be found in the vehicle handbook.

allQuestions.question: What is an effect of under-inflated tyres on a vehicle?
options: Impaired braking and steering.
Increased wear on the vehicle's engine.
Improved braking and steering.
Improved fuel economy and braking.
allQuestions.explanation: Drivers should check their vehicle's tyre pressures (including the spare) regularly at least once a week. Under-inflated tyres adversely affect many of a vehicle's systems, including braking ability, suspension, steering, fuel consumption and premature tyre wear. Tyres should always be inflated according to the vehicle manufacturer's guidelines, information on which can be found in the vehicle

allQuestions.question: While driving at higher speeds, what does a continuous vibration in the steering indicate?
options: The shock absorbers are worn.
The wheel balance is uneven.
The steering is out of alignment.
Weight distribution is uneven.
allQuestions.explanation: If a driver feels a continuous vibration in the steering, particularly at higher speeds, this could typically indicate that the balance of the vehicle wheels is uneven. This can lead to instability in the handling of the vehicle. If this is the case, have it investigated by a competent person.

allQuestions.question: After changing a wheel on a vehicle, which of the following should be checked after a short distance?
options: The wheel nut tightness.
The tyre air valve.
The brake pad clearance.
The tyre tread depth.
allQuestions.explanation: After changing a wheel on a vehicle, check the tightness of the wheel nuts or studs on the replacement wheel after driving a short distance to ensure they are securely fitted. If in doubt seek assistance from a competent person.

allQuestions.question: When braking, what determines how quickly the vehicle will slow down and stop?
options: The amount of downward pressure applied to the brake pedal.
The amount of upward pressure applied to the brake pedal.
The amount of downward pressure applied to the accelerator.
allQuestions.explanation: The amount of downward pressure put on the brake pedal determines how quickly the vehicle will slow down and stop. In the normal course of driving, drivers should read the road ahead and learn to brake in good time and progressively.

allQuestions.question: When driving, where should a driver rest their left foot?
options: Under the brake pedal.
Under the clutch pedal.
On the floor or foot rest.
On the clutch pedal.
allQuestions.explanation: When driving a driver should rest their left foot on the floor or foot rest but not under the pedals. To do so may cause delayed response time in an emergency. Resting the foot on the pedal may result in coasting, which may inadvertently increase the speed of the vehicle, or clutch mechanism damage.

allQuestions.question: On a motorway, when should a driver use the hazard warning lights?
options: When towing another vehicle.
When driving on the hard shoulder.
When another vehicle is following too closely.
When slowing down quickly because of danger ahead.
allQuestions.explanation: Use the hazard warning lights to warn other road users of a danger ahead. For example, if you have to slow down sharply because of a build-up of traffic ahead, you can use the hazard warning lights to warn following vehicles that they need to  slow down.

allQuestions.question: What should a driver do if the fuel system becomes air-locked?
options: Tighten the injector pipes.
Loosen the fuel pump.
Bleed the air out of the fuel system.
Drain the fuel filter.
allQuestions.explanation: The fuel system can become air-locked if you let the fuel get too low or if there is a leak in the system. You should have the problem corrected before driving. The solution may be as simple as bleeding the fuel system to release the air.

allQuestions.question: Under what circumstances could both cross-ply and radial tyres be fitted to a vehicle?
options: When each type is fitted on a different axle.
When heavy loads are being carried.
When towing a trailer in snow.
When driving in slippery road conditions.
allQuestions.explanation: In general, you should fit the same type of tyres all round the vehicle. However if you need to fit a mix of cross-ply and radials, the tyres on any axle should be of the same type.
